#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tell the Difference Between Social Media and Traditional Marketing
#Text=Social media marketing is almost taking over the traditional marketing landscape due to its cost effective nature and interactivity .

#Text=Unlike traditional marketing , social media campaigns can be sculpted and toned to accommodate a specific target market with almost continuous updates as the market 's tastes and interests change and evolve .
#Text=Since social media is still in its infancy stages , some consumers have a difficult time discerning between traditional versus social even though the two vehicles are light years apart .
#Text=Here are a few steps you can take to determine the difference between social media versus traditional marketing .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine if you can interact with the media or advertising .
#Text=Social media is interactive , whereas traditional marketing is passive .
#Text=Can you respond or “ talk back ” to the ad ?
#Text=Watching television , listening to the radio or reading a newspaper , for example are all forms of traditional marketing .
#Text=The reader/viewer/listener is passively reading the paper , watching TV or listening to the radio and is confronted with an ad .
#Text=The only way around the advertising is to turn the channel or page .
#Text=Whether you want the ad or not , you get it .
#Text=However , with social media you are prompted to interact with the marketing whether it 's clicking on the ad or commenting on the post or Tweet .
#Text=Is there a call to action that can be addressed immediately ?
#Text=For example , with social media , while checking your Facebook page you may see advertisements running along the side of your page .
#Text=These ads are designed especially for your taste based on your interaction with Facebook .
#Text=If you are a Cleveland Browns fan , you may see opportunities to order football bobble heads or sportswear .
#Text=So while you may not be in the market for a new Cleveland Browns bobble head you are more likely to click on the ad based on your interests .
#Text=With a traditional campaign there is no “ immediate gratification ” and the reader/viewer/listener must wait to take action , such as drive to or call the store to obtain the product .
#Text=Decide if the ad promotes relationship building .
#Text=Traditional media will often present the product or offer , but the “ interaction ” ends there .
#Text=When it comes to social media , the company and consumer truly interact and react off each other .
#Text=Can you prompt discussion and networking through the ad ?
#Text=In today 's social media society , it 's all about networking and relationship building .
#Text=Consumers can actively choose to follow or “ like ” certain businesses and may be prompted to act based on incentives or the receipt of ongoing news and information .
#Text=Traditional media is simply product presentation -- no networking or relationships can be built with the company or amongst consumers .
#Text=Can you easily encourage friends or your network to discover the ad ?
#Text=With social media you may find commonality with other friends or family members as you build a relationship with the company .
#Text=One example is with the site Groupon where the more interest conjured up from friends and networks , the more likely the deal will come to fruition for all .
#Text=Plus social sites like Groupon can be shared on other social vehicles like Twitter and Facebook .
#Text=When it comes to traditional media , there is no connectivity .
#Text=If you choose to shop with a certain store or brand you can possibly sign up for a mailing list to receive coupons or other correspondence but the relationship typically stops at that point .
#Text=The best way to network through traditional media is through social media or by emailing information to friends and/or cutting out ads and giving them to friends .
#Text=Determine if the media can be quickly customized to accommodate a specific audience .
#Text=Unlike traditional media , most social media vehicles are created online , allowing for a more malleable platform .
#Text=For example , social media campaigns can be tested for only a few dollars .
#Text=The business may find that upon test , the offer is too weak or it should have featured a different product .
#Text=Within hours the offer can be revised and tweaked , then reissued -- all within the same day and for little cash outlay .
#Text=However , when it comes to traditional media the cost to print or produce a new ad ( print , radio or TV ) it comes down to time and money to reproduce , reprint and redistribute .
#Text=Determine how long the ad is or can be relevant .
#Text=Both social and traditional media can be relevant for numerous years .
#Text=For example , famous TV or newspaper ads from the past continue to live on in the hearts and minds of fans across the globe .
#Text=The only difference is that while traditional and social media can have the same creative impact , they both do not have the same lifespan accessibility .
#Text=Can you conjure up the mass media ad on demand ?
#Text=Consider what happens during the Super Bowl and the highly anticipated advertisements that accompany the big game .
#Text=While creative and engaging , the ad appears and then it may reappear again in the future when you watch TV , but you ca n't access it on your own -- a perfect example of traditional media .
#Text=Quite the contrary , with social media ads , you can nab it on YouTube or Facebook whenever you want to watch it .
#Text=You can also share the ad with friends and family members -- part of social media 's relationship building appeal .
#Text=Can you control what you watch ?
#Text=With traditional media you must watch the entire ad , even though your favorite part happens during the last two seconds .
#Text=With social media you can rewind or fast forward at your whim .
#Text=However this method only works with mass media ( visual or audio ) marketing .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you are unsure which media you are dealing with , ask yourself , “ Can I interact with it , respond to it or join it ? ”
#Text=If you can , you are dealing with social media .
#Text=Both traditional and social media marketing can be blended and used harmoniously .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Check the rules and regulations with social media sites before posting contests or specific promotions .
